trans-unit.source: Collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Material"></xref> objects.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MaterialGroup.Children%2A> property of <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MaterialGroup> is a MaterialCollection.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MaterialCollection"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MaterialCollection"></xref> class using the specified collection.
Collection with which to instantiate the MaterialCollection.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MaterialCollection"></xref> class with the specified capacity.
Integer that specifies the capacity of the MaterialCollection.
Adds a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Material"></xref> to the end of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MaterialCollection"></xref>.
Item to add to the end of this collection.
Removes all the items from this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MaterialCollection"></xref>.
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MaterialCollection"></xref>, making deep copies of this object's values.
When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.

The cloned object's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property will be <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> even if the source's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property was <xref uid="langword_csharp_true." name="true." href=""></xref>
To be added.
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MaterialCollection"></xref> object, making deep copies of this object's current values.
Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
A modifiable clone of the current object.

The cloned object's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property will be <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> even if the source's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property was <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
To be added.
Determines whether a given <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Material"></xref> is in this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MaterialCollection"></xref>.
The item to locate in this collection.
if value, the specified Material, is in this MaterialCollection; otherwise, .

Copies the items of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MaterialCollection"></xref>, starting with the specified index value, into an array of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Material"></xref> objects.
The array that is the destination of the items copied from this MaterialCollection.
The index at which copying begins.
Gets the number of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Material"></xref> objects contained in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MaterialCollection"></xref>.
The number of Material objects contained in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MaterialCollection"></xref>.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
Returns an enumerator that can iterate through the collection.
Enumerators only allow reading the data in the collection.
Enumerators cannot be used to modify the underlying collection.
Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first item in the collection.
At this position, calling <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MaterialCollection.Enumerator.Current%2A> throws an exception.

Therefore, you must call <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MaterialCollection.Enumerator.MoveNext%2A> to advance the enumerator to the first item of the collection before reading the value of Current.
Current returns the same object until either MoveNext or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MaterialCollection.Enumerator.Reset%2A> is called.
MoveNext sets Current to the next item.
After the end of the collection is passed, the enumerator is positioned after the last item in the collection, and calling MoveNext returns false.
If the last call to MoveNext returned false, calling Current throws an exception.
To set Current to the first item of the collection again, you can call Reset followed by MoveNext.
An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged.

If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying or deleting items, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and the next call to MoveNext or Reset throws an InvalidOperationException.
If the collection is modified between MoveNext and Current, Current will return the item that it is set to, even if the enumerator is already invalidated.
The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure.
Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads could still modify the collection, which causes the enumerator to throw an exception.
To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can either lock the collection during the entire enumeration or catch the exceptions resulting from changes made by other threads.
An enumerator that can iterate the collection.
Gets the index position of the first occurrence of the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Material"></xref>.
The Material to search for.
The index position of the specified Material.
Inserts a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Material"></xref> into this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MaterialCollection"></xref> at the specified index position.
The index position at which to insert the specified Material.
The Material to insert.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Material"></xref> at the specified zero-based index.
The zero-based index of the Material object to get or set.
The item at the specified index.
Removes the first occurrence of the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Material"></xref> from the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MaterialCollection"></xref>.
The Material to remove from this collection.
if value was removed from the collection; otherwise, .
Removes the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Material"></xref> at the specified index position from the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MaterialCollection"></xref>.
The index position of the Material to remove.
To be added.

The first position in the specified <xref:System.Array> to receive the copied contents.
